g.text: Before deciding how and where to store the data, it is essential to choose the appropriate storage level.
e.g., NFS, CephFS, or HDF5. It can be accessed
over the network by multiple physical
Despite its simplicity, filesystem-level storage is appropriate for a variety of use-cases, including:
allows to store and share data with
a small group of colleagues with minimal effort
thanks to the availability and accessibility
Parallel access to the data on the filesystem level is fast for retrieval access but slow for storage
Application Programming Interface (API) defined over a filesystem
Using an API, you can programmatically execute GET, PUT, or DELETE on files...
...without worrying where the files are actually stored.
Typically provided by an API service available on the network and accessible by HTTP
or, more generally, TCP/IP or a different communication protocol suite.
be built into the API service
The access to the data stored on the object storage level can often be done in parallel..
.. but the access is not as fast as on the filesystem level
e.g., Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storager (GVS), Ceph
The database level of data storage allows persistent, fast, and scalable storage of structured data
with fast parallel access for both storage and retrieval!
A modern Database Management System (DBMS) stores data in RAM, but sw ensures that data is persisted to disk
- A row has a unique ID and contains values in columns
- In a relational database, rows are organized in tables.
Not exceptionally well suited for storing binary data, though rather small binary objects can sometimes be stored as blobs.
e.g., Oracle, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, PostgresSQL
A data lake is a repository of data stored in its natural or raw format, usually in the form of object blobs or files.
Typically an unstructured aggregation of data from multiple sources, including DBs, logs, ..
.. or intermediary data obtained as a result of expensive transformations of the original data.
The data is saved in the data lake in its raw format
To read data, the analyst needs to write the programming code that reads and parses the data stored in a file or blob
Writing a script to parse the data file or a blob is called schema on read, as opposed to the schema on write in DBMS
